awards.description: THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE CHOCTAW NATION TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS. SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BUILD ENVIRONMENTAL CAPACITY TO MANAGE THE ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE, STAFF EDUCATION AND TRAINING, AND DEVELOP A DRINKING WATER BASELINE NEEDS ASSESSMENT.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO THE CHOCTAW NATION TO BUILD ITS CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFICALLY, THE RECIPIENT WILL BUILD CAPACITY OF OFFICE STAFF TO LEARN AND ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, OBTAIN PHASE II SAMPLING STAFF TRAINING AND SUPPLIES, CATALOGUE TRIBAL ECOLOGICAL KNOWLEDGE PLANTS FOR FUTURE LAND RESTORATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, ANNUAL FEDERAL FINANCIAL REPORT, QUALITY MANAGEMENT PLAN,

awards.awarding_agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development
Department of Housing and Urban Development

awards.description:
DESCRIPTION:THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO THE CHOCTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA IN ITS EFFORTS TO ADDRESS AIR POLLUTION CONCERNS ON THE TRIBE'S RESERVATION AND SURROUNDING TRIBAL LANDS IN THE STATE OF OKLAHOMA.  THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW THE TRIBE TO BUILD CAPACITY TO BETTER UNDERSTAND AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, CONDUCT A BASELINE AIR QUALITY PROJECT INCLUDING THE PER#8208; AND POLYFLUOROALKYL SUBSTANCES (PFAS) SAMPLING IN RAINWATER AT TWO LOCATIONS AS PART OF THE NATIONAL ATMOSPHERIC DEPOSITION PROGRAM (NADP) - NATIONAL TRENDS NETWORK (NTN), DEVELOP A BASELINE FOR INDOOR AIR QUALITY (IAQ) IN CHOCTAW NATION CASINOS, PARTICIPATE IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL WORK GROUPS, AND PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH IN THE COMMUNITY.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SCOPE OF THE SECTION 103 AUTHORITY INCLUDING: 1) SUPPORTING THE TRIBAL AIR STAFF'S CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT THROUGH TRAINING, 2) ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING TWO NADP#8208;NTN SITES IN COOPERATION WITH THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN#8208;MADISON AND THE EPA OFFICE OF ATMOSPHERIC PROGRAMS FOR THE PFAS DEPOSITION MONITORING STUDY. MONITORING SITES WILL BE LOCATED AT SAVANNA, OK AND MCCURTAIN COUNTY, OKLAHOMA, 3) DEVELOP A MONITORING PLAN, AND 4) DEVELOP AN AIR MONITORING QAPP, 5) CONDUCT BASELINE SAMPLING FOR IAQ EMISSIONS UTILIZING LOW#8208;COST SENSORS FOR PARTICULATE MATTER 2.5 (PM2.5), CARBON DIOXIDE (CO2), AND TOTAL VOLATILE ORGANIC COMPOUNDS (TVOC) AT CHOCTAW NATION CASINOS, 6) PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL CONFERENCES AND WORKGROUPS, AND 7) CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION IN THE COMMUNITY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE TRIBAL STAFF BUILDING CAPACITY FOR AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT, ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING TWO NADP#8208;NTN SITES, SAMPLING IAQ EMISSIONS AT CHOCTAW NATION CASINOS, PARTICIPATION IN REGIONAL AND NATIONAL CONFERENCES AND WORKGROUPS, AND CONDUCTING OUTREACH AND EDUCATION IN THE COMMUNITY.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES FROM THIS AGREEMENT ARE AN INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF MONITORING AND REPORTING AS OUTLINED IN THE APPROVED QAPP, ESTABLISHED MONITORING SITE FOR PFAS DEPOSITION MONITORING IN COORDINATION WITH THE NADP-NTN PROGRAMS, PROTECTION OF THE ENVIRONMENT AND PUBLIC HEALTH WHILE IMPLEMENTING EPA PRIORITY OF BETTER UNDERSTANDING AND ADDRESSING PFAS IN THE ENVIRONMENT, ASSISTING REGIONAL COVERAGE IN FULFILLING DATA GAPS FOR SOUTHEASTERN OKLAHOMA WHILE INCREASING THE PERCENTAGE OF COMMUNITIES IN INDIAN COUNTRY WITH POTENTIAL AIR QUALITY PROBLEMS THAT HAVE BEEN MONITORED.

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF CHOCTAW NATION AND SURROUNDING AREAS.
